Solution: The pop-up elements in old style pop-up books would come to life and pop up when the reader physically lifted a flap or turned a page. This interactive feature would engage readers and make the story more visually appealing.

Problem 2: How did old style pop-up books make the reading experience more interactive?
Solution: Old style pop-up books made the reading experience more interactive by incorporating three-dimensional pop-up elements that would surprise and engage the reader when certain actions were taken, such as lifting a flap or turning a page. This tactile and visual interaction enhanced the storytelling experience.

Problem 3: What feature of old style pop-up books allowed readers to physically interact with the story?
Solution: The physical interaction in old style pop-up books involved lifting flaps, turning pages, and exploring hidden pop-up elements that would come to life as the reader engaged with the book. This interactive aspect made reading more fun and engaging for readers.

Therefore, the final answer is: B. visualize
